definition: (old) to bow and utter polite phrases/to open the way (for a dignitary etc)
to answer respectfully "yes"
to sing/to call loudly/to chant
(indicating agreement) yes/all right/(drawing attention to) look!/here!/variant of 諾|诺[nuo4]
to salute/make one's curtsy
to kowtow in salute
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to salute/to greet
to promise/to agree to do sth
old-fashioned women's obeisance/Taiwan pr. [lian4 ren4]
to salute/to make one's salutations
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
to bow respectfully with clasped hands/to beg humbly
to greet by raising clasped hands
to bow with hands held in front
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
variant of 斂衽|敛衽[lian3 ren4]
to greet/to go out to meet
to shout at/to berate
to await (your) gracious presence
